H0.text: Muscle cells help skin feel heat and pressure.

H1.text: Blood cells help skin feel heat and pressure.

H2.text: Nerve cells help skin feel heat and pressure.

H3.text: Bone cells help skin feel heat and pressure.

A4.text: When pressure is applied and the corpuscle is deformed, mechanical stimulus is transferred to the axon, which fires.

A5.text: Sensory neurons respond to stimuli such as touch, sound, or light that affect the cells of the sensory organs, and they send signals to the spinal cord and then to the sensorial area in the brain.
